thread.title: Call of Duty: Warzone Players Point Out Missing Verdansk Feature - OpenCritic
thread.title_full: Call of Duty: Warzone Players Point Out Missing Verdansk Feature - OpenCritic

title: Call of Duty: Warzone Players Point Out Missing Verdansk Feature - OpenCritic
text:
Call of Duty: Warzone players have noticed that Season 3 Reloaded's Verdansk is missing rooftop ziplines and exterior ascenders that were available during Season 5 of the original Warzone. Ahead of the Season 3 Reloaded launch, many Call of Duty: Warzone players expected the ziplines and ascenders to be present, making traversal more streamlined on the map.
On April 2, the Call of Duty: Warzone Season 3 update brought a rebuilt version of Verdansk with new light adjustments, quality-of-life improvements, and features that are faithful, including Buy Stations, Points of Interest, Killstreaks, and Easter eggs. Elements from the original Warzone's later seasons were added as well, such as Metro Station entrances and other map changes. What's more, the Call of Duty: Warzone Season 3 update brought multiple modes, including 150-player Battle Royale and the new Battle Royale Casual mode, which supports up to 120 bots and 28 real players. On May 1, the Season 3 Reloaded update will bring some updates to the Verdansk map to bring it up to speed with the original iteration of the map.
